p: Cryptolepis sanguinolenta (Apocynaceae) was the plant with the highest antibiotic activity expressed in the lower MIC. The alkaloid cryptolepine was isolated from this plant. The root of the plant is used in traditional medicine in West Africa for the treatment of various infectious diseases including diarrhea, mostly through decoction [ 30, 38]. Additionally, the plant is traditionally used in the continent to treat fever, upper respiratory infections, urinary tract infections, septicemia, respiratory diseases, other enteric diseases, insomnia, amoebiasis, hypertension, inflammation, pyrexia, malaria, diabetes, stomach and intestinal disorders, tuberculosis, hepatitis, and wounds [ 38].
